greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Balanced nonary enumeration (or balanced nonary representation) of integers; write n in nonary (base 9) and then replace 5's with (-4)'s, 6's with (-3)'s, 7's with (-2)'s, and 8's with (-1)'s.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..6560
example: Since 35_10=38_9, the digits of 35 in base 9 are 3 and 8. 8>4, so it is replaced with (-1). The digits are then 3 and -1, so a(35)=3*9^1+(-1)*9^0=27-1=26.
results.author: _Jackson Haselhorst_, Aug 26 2019
